A reference covering photo grids, wide photos, lightbox features, typography, tables,
callouts, columns, layout width classes, figure layouts, video embeds, asides, and more.

## Photo Grids

The `.photo-grid` class creates a 4-column grid by default. Add `.cols-1` through `.cols-6`
to change the column count. Showing all 6 layouts below.

## Wide Photo

The `.photo-wide` class shows a single image at full content width with a max height of
500px. Good for hero-style shots within a post.

::: {.photo-wide}
![Pont Alexandre III at dusk](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1520939817895-060bdaf4fe1b?w=1200&auto=format&q=80){group="wide" description="Pont Alexandre III at dusk." width="1200" height="800"}
:::

## Lightbox Groups

All images on this site open in a lightbox when clicked. The `group` attribute links
images into a shared gallery so you can arrow between them. Different `group` values
create separate galleries on the same page.

The `description` attribute adds a caption in the lightbox overlay — visible when you
click any image on this page.

### Inline Formatting

| Syntax | Result |
|--------|--------|
| `**bold**` | **bold** |
| `*italic*` | *italic* |
| `***bold italic***` | ***bold italic*** |
| `~~strikethrough~~` | ~~strikethrough~~ |
| `^superscript^` | ^superscript^ |
| `~subscript~` | ~subscript~ |
| `` `inline code` `` | `inline code` |
| `[link text](url)` | [link text](https://example.com) |

## Code Blocks

Inline: use `quarto render` to build the site.

Fenced block with syntax highlighting:

```yaml
# _quarto.yml excerpt
format:
  html:
    theme:
      - default
      - styles/moving.scss
    css: styles/styles.css
    lightbox: true
```

```css
/* Column modifier — 3 columns */
.photo-grid.cols-3 {
    grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
}
```

## Horizontal Rule

Content above the rule.

* * *

Content below the rule. Use `* * *` in Quarto — not `---`, which is interpreted as
a YAML delimiter.

## Math

Inline math: the focal length and aperture relationship is $N = f / D$ where $N$ is the
f-number, $f$ is focal length, and $D$ is the entrance pupil diameter.

Display math:

$$
\text{Exposure Value} = \log_2\!\left(\frac{N^2}{t}\right)
$$

where $N$ is the f-number and $t$ is exposure time in seconds.

## Layout Width Classes

Quarto provides built-in classes to push content beyond the default body width.
These work without any custom CSS.

### Body Outset

Slightly wider than the body column — good for a photo that deserves a bit more room.

:::{.column-body-outset}
![Tuileries Garden](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1524396309943-e03f5249f002?w=1400&auto=format&q=80){group="layout" description="Tuileries Garden — body outset width."}
:::

### Page Width

Spans the full page width (including margins), wider than body outset.

:::{.column-page}
![Champs-Élysées lights](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1545622783-b3e021430fee?w=1600&auto=format&q=80){group="layout" description="Champs-Élysées — page width."}
:::

### Screen Width

Edge-to-edge, filling the entire browser window.

:::{.column-screen}
![Shibuya crossing](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1542051841857-5f90071e7989?w=1600&auto=format&q=80){group="layout" description="Shibuya crossing — full screen width."}
:::

## Figure Layouts

The `layout` attribute arranges multiple images in custom grid patterns — more
flexible than `.photo-grid` for asymmetric arrangements.

Two equal images side by side:

::: {layout="[1,1]"}
![Montmartre](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1550340499-a6c60fc8287c?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Montmartre streets."}

![Café](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1514933651103-005eec06c04b?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Corner café."}
:::

Two rows — two images on top, one spanning below:

::: {layout="[[1,1],[1]]"}
![Louvre at night](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1499856871958-5b9627545d1a?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="The Louvre pyramid."}

![Eiffel Tower](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1460904577954-8fadb262612c?w=600&auto=format&q=80){group="fig-layout" description="Eiffel Tower from Trocadéro."}

## Photo Strip

sequences like a walk through a market or a meal course by course. Images display at

## Figure Captions and Sub-Captions

Give the parent div a `#fig-` label and each image its own `#fig-` label. The last
line of text in the div becomes the main caption. Each image's alt text becomes its
sub-caption. Quarto numbers them automatically (Figure 1 (a), (b), (c), etc.).

::: {#fig-tokyo layout-ncol=3}
![Shibuya](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1542051841857-5f90071e7989?w=600&auto=format&q=80){#fig-shibuya group="figcap"}

![Senso-ji](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1528360983277-13d401cdc186?w=600&auto=format&q=80){#fig-sensoji group="figcap"}

![Shinjuku](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1536098561742-ca998e48cbcc?w=600&auto=format&q=80){#fig-shinjuku group="figcap"}

Three views of Tokyo
:::

## Cross-References {#sec-crossref}

Add `#fig-label` to an image to create a numbered figure that can be referenced
elsewhere in the text with `@fig-label`.

![Cherry blossoms along the Meguro River](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1522383225653-ed111181a951?w=1200&auto=format&q=80){#fig-meguro group="crossref" description="Peak bloom along the Meguro River canal." width="70%"}

As shown in @fig-meguro, the Meguro River is one of the best spots for cherry
blossoms in Tokyo. Cross-references automatically generate numbered labels and
become clickable links.

## Text Wrap Balance

The CSS `text-wrap: balance` property balances line lengths in headings so no
line is awkwardly shorter than others.

::: {style="max-width: 300px;"}
[A Long Heading That Will Definitely Wrap Onto Multiple Lines]{style="display: block; font-size: 1.4rem; font-weight: 700; text-wrap: auto; margin-bottom: 1rem;"}

[A Long Heading That Will Definitely Wrap Onto Multiple Lines]{style="display: block; font-size: 1.4rem; font-weight: 700; text-wrap: balance; margin-bottom: 1rem;"}
:::

The first uses `text-wrap: auto` (default) and the second uses `text-wrap: balance`.
The balanced version distributes words more evenly across lines.

## Bootstrap Carousel

Since Quarto uses Bootstrap, carousels work natively with raw HTML. The slideshow
auto-advances and includes prev/next controls.

```{=html}
<div id="carouselDemo" class="carousel slide" data-bs-ride="carousel" style="max-width: 800px; margin: 2rem auto;">
  <div class="carousel-indicators">
    <button type="button" data-bs-target="#carouselDemo" data-bs-slide-to="0" class="active"></button>
    <button type="button" data-bs-target="#carouselDemo" data-bs-slide-to="1"></button>
    <button type="button" data-bs-target="#carouselDemo" data-bs-slide-to="2"></button>
    <button type="button" data-bs-target="#carouselDemo" data-bs-slide-to="3"></button>
  </div>
  <div class="carousel-inner" style="border-radius: 3px; overflow: hidden;">
    <div class="carousel-item active">
      <img src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1542051841857-5f90071e7989?w=800&auto=format&q=80" class="d-block w-100" style="height: 400px; object-fit: cover;" alt="Shibuya crossing">
      <div class="carousel-caption d-none d-md-block">
        <p>Shibuya crossing</p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="carousel-item">
      <img src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1528360983277-13d401cdc186?w=800&auto=format&q=80" class="d-block w-100" style="height: 400px; object-fit: cover;" alt="Temple gate">
      <div class="carousel-caption d-none d-md-block">
        <p>Senso-ji temple</p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="carousel-item">
      <img src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1536098561742-ca998e48cbcc?w=800&auto=format&q=80" class="d-block w-100" style="height: 400px; object-fit: cover;" alt="Neon at night">
      <div class="carousel-caption d-none d-md-block">
        <p>Shinjuku neon</p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="carousel-item">
      <img src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1557872943-16a5ac26437e?w=800&auto=format&q=80" class="d-block w-100" style="height: 400px; object-fit: cover;" alt="Ramen">
      <div class="carousel-caption d-none d-md-block">
        <p>Tonkotsu ramen</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <button class="carousel-control-prev" type="button" data-bs-target="#carouselDemo" data-bs-slide="prev">
    <span class="carousel-control-prev-icon"></span>
  </button>
  <button class="carousel-control-next" type="button" data-bs-target="#carouselDemo" data-bs-slide="next">
    <span class="carousel-control-next-icon"></span>
  </button>
</div>
```

## Diagrams

Quarto renders Mermaid and Graphviz diagrams inline. Useful for trip planning,
route maps, or timelines.

### Mermaid

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 5
%%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#faeee8', 'primaryBorderColor': '#c4653a', 'primaryTextColor': '#3a2a1f', 'lineColor': '#c4653a', 'edgeLabelBackground': '#faf8f5', 'fontFamily': 'IBM Plex Sans'}}}%%
graph LR
    A[Tokyo] -->|Shinkansen| B[Kyoto]
    B -->|Bus| C[Nara]
    C -->|Train| B
    B -->|Shinkansen| D[Osaka]
```

### Graphviz

```{dot}
//| fig-cap: "Tokyo itinerary"
//| label: fig-graphviz
digraph {
    rankdir=LR
    node [shape=box style=rounded fontname="IBM Plex Sans"]
    "Day 1-3" -> "Asakusa & Ueno"
    "Day 4-5" -> "Shibuya & Harajuku"
    "Day 6-7" -> "Day trips"
    "Day trips" -> "Kamakura"
    "Day trips" -> "Nikko"
}
```

## Grayscale Click Toggle

Wrap an image in `.grayscale-toggle` to start it in black & white. Clicking toggles
to full color and back.

```{=html}
<div class="grayscale-toggle" onclick="this.classList.toggle('is-color')">
```

## Image Comparison Slider

The `img-comparison-slider` web component (~3KB) creates a draggable before/after
slider — useful for photo editing showcases. Drag the handle to compare the two
versions.

```{=html}
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/img-comparison-slider@8/dist/styles.css">
<script defer src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/img-comparison-slider@8/dist/index.js"></script>
<img-comparison-slider>
  <img slot="first" src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1502602898657-3e91760cbb34?w=1000&auto=format&q=80&sat=-100" alt="Before — desaturated" />
  <img slot="second" src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1502602898657-3e91760cbb34?w=1000&auto=format&q=80" alt="After — full color" />
</img-comparison-slider>
```

## Trip Map

The `.trip-map` class renders a small, non-interactive Leaflet map showing a trip's
country or region. Add a `<div>` with `data-lat`, `data-lng`, `data-zoom`, and
`data-label` attributes — the script in `_metadata.yml` initializes it automatically.
Uses CartoDB Positron tiles (light) or Dark Matter (dark mode) with an orange marker
matching the site accent color.

```{=html}
<div class="trip-map" data-lat="35.6762" data-lng="139.6503" data-zoom="5" data-label="Tokyo, Japan"></div>
```
